GlobalVariables.StudyDescription: This file contains the metadata, events, and data for REDCap project "PROTECT-CH".

redcap:DataQualityRules.rule_name: Age is not over 65
PLR both email addresses don't match
PLR paper informed consent sent date must be after PLR details entered date
Scheduled appointment date must be after date trial information given to resident
Scheduled appointment date must be after the PLR entered details date
Scheduled appointment date must be after the date sent information to PLR
Scheduled appointment date must be after previous scheduled appointment date & time
Resident consent signed date must be after appointment date when video call is completed
Resident consent name is not the same in the resident capacity form
Witness consent signed date must be after video call appointment date when video call is completed
Resident paper consent uploaded date must be after date of resident taking consent or witness taking consent
PLR consent date must be after appointment date when video call is completed
PLR consent name is not the same in the PLR details form
PLR paper consent uploaded date must be after date of PLR signed consent date
PLR paper consent uploaded date must be after consent completed date
Research nurse countersigned resident online consent date must be after resident consent signed date
Research nurse countersigned resident paper consent date must be after NCTU uploaded date
Research nurse countersigned PLR online consent date must be after PLR consent completed date
Research nurse countersigned PLR paper consent date must be after NCTU uploaded PLR consent date
Resident paper consent file is not uploaded in GP eligibility form
Resident paper consent file is uploaded in GP eligibility form but paper consent is not upload by NCTU
PLR paper consent file is not uploaded in GP eligibility form
PLR paper consent file is uploaded in GP eligibility form but NCTU is not uploaded PLR consent
GP signed date must be after RN countersigned date
redcap:DataQualityRules.rule_logic: [eligibility_arm_1][gp_sign_date] <> '' and ( ([consent_arm_1][rn_csign_date] <> '' and datediff([consent_arm_1][rn_csign_date],[eligibility_arm_1][gp_sign_date], "d", true) < 0) or ([consent_arm_1][rn_sign_date] <> '' and datediff([consent_arm_1][rn_sign_date],[eligibility_arm_1][gp_sign_date], "d", true) < 0) )

redcap:DataQualityRules.rule_name: NCTU checked scr date must be after GP eligibility signed date
PI reviewed a copy of the resident's SCR is no but NCTU checked SCR is in the vault
PI signed date must be after outbreak date
Number can't be zero in weight or height or demi-span measurement
Date resident moved into the care home must be before given trial information to resident or PLR
First new changed PLR verbal agreed date must be after RN countersigned date
redcap:DataQualityRules.rule_logic: [first_plr] = 1 and [consent_arm_1][verbal_date2]<> '' and ( ([rn_sign_date] <> '' and datediff([rn_sign_date] , [consent_arm_1][verbal_date2], 'd', true) < 0) or ([rn_csign_date] <> '' and datediff([rn_csign_date] , [consent_arm_1][verbal_date2], 'd', true) < 0) )

redcap:DataQualityRules.rule_name: New PLR verbal date must be after previous PLR verbal date
Next Vaccination Dose must be after Last Dose
Vaccinations only need to be reported up to 60 days after randomisation date
Date of PCR test must be after the lateral flow test.
Date returning to care home from hospitalisation must be after the hospital admission.
COVID-19 symptoms must be between randomisation date and 60 days after randomisation date
COVID-19 test date must be between randomisation date and 60 days after randomisation date
Date the resident first received Dexamethasone must be between randomisation date and 60 days after randomisation date
Date the resident first received Oxygen must be between randomisation date and 60 days after randomisation date
Date healthcare support first sought must be between randomisation date and 60 days after randomisation date
Date admitted to hospital must be between randomisation date and 60 days after randomisation date
Date of death must be between randomisation date and 60 days after randomisation date
The resident has experienced Covid-19 symptoms but no Covid-19 symptoms have been selected
redcap:DataQualityRules.rule_logic: [cov19_sym] = '1' and [cov19_cough] = '0' and [cov19_fever] = '0' and [cov19_taste] = '0' and [cov19_appetite] = '0' and [cov19_confusion] = '0' and [cov19_sym_other] = '0'

redcap:DataQualityRules.rule_name: COVID-19 Event cannot have completed status and awaiting test results
Only one death can be reported
For each Healthcare support contact you cannot have no contact and contact reported
redcap:DataQualityRules.rule_logic: (([hc_type_gp(1)] = 1 or [hc_type_gp(2)] = 1) and [hc_type_gp(0)] = 1) or (([hc_type_hosp_doctor(1)] = 1 or [hc_type_hosp_doctor(2)] = 1) and [hc_type_hosp_doctor(0)] = 1) or (([hc_type_nurse(1)] = 1 or [hc_type_nurse(2)] = 1) and [hc_type_nurse(0)] = 1) or (([hc_type_nurse_specialist(1)] = 1 or [hc_type_nurse_specialist(2)] = 1) and [hc_type_nurse_specialist(0)] = 1) or (([hc_type_allied_health_prof(1)] = 1 or [hc_type_allied_health_prof(2)] = 1 ) and [hc_type_allied_health_prof(0)] = 1) or (([hc_type_111(1)] = 1 or [hc_type_111(1)] = 1) and [hc_type_111(0)] = 1) or (([hc_type_999(1)] = 1 or [hc_type_999(1)] = 1) and [hc_type_999(0)] = 1)

redcap:DataQualityRules.rule_name: Treatment start date must be after the randomisation date
Discontinuation must be between start date and end date
Discontinuation must be between start date and end date
The number of treatment doses cannot exceed the maximum number of doses for trial treatment.
The number of treatment doses cannot exceed the maximum number of doses for the first week of treatment.
The number of treatment doses cannot exceed the maximum number of doses for last week.
Is the reason for missing treatment correct?
redcap:DataQualityRules.rule_logic: ([event-name] = 'week_1_arm_1' and ([treat_miss_reason] = 9 OR [treat_miss_reason] = 10)) OR ([event-name] = 'week_7_arm_1' and ([treat_miss_reason] = 8)) OR ([event-name] <> 'week_1_arm_1' AND [event-name] <> 'week_7_arm_1' AND [treat_miss_reason] = 8 OR [treat_miss_reason] = 9)

redcap:DataQualityRules.rule_name: The reason for missing doses is 'death' but reason for discontinuing treatment is not recorded as 'death'
The serious adverse event date must be after the randomisation date
Serious Adverse Events no longer need to be reported
The serious adverse event must be reported after the event date
Unexpected trial treatment data in SAE.
Classification unexpected due to relationship to IMP or trial treatment
redcap:DataQualityRules.rule_logic: ([ae_related] = 1 or [ae_related] = 2 or [ae_related] = 3) and ([ae_class] = 2 or [ae_class_nosar] = 2 or [ae_class_noar] =2) OR ([ae_related] = 4) and ([ae_class] = 3 or [ae_class] = 4 or [ae_class_nosar] =4)

redcap:DataQualityRules.rule_name: The serious adverse event evaluation sign off date must be after the event reported date
The serious adverse event follow up date must be after the event evaluation sign off date
Date and time of last dose must be after treatment start date and prior to event date
At least severity for one gastrointestinal symptom must be selected as a gastrointestinal adverse event has been experienced by the resident
redcap:DataQualityRules.rule_logic: [ae_gastro] = 1 and [ae_nausea] = 1 and [ae_vomit] = 1 and [ae_taste] = 1 and [ae_indigest] = 1 and [ae_stomach_cramps] = 1 and [ae_gagging] = 1 and [ae_diarrhoea] = 1 and [ae_no_appetite] = 1 and [ae_rectal_itching] = 1 and [ae_oral_thrush] = 1

redcap:DataQualityRules.rule_name: At least severity for one neuro-psychiatric symptom must be selected as a neuro-psychiatric adverse event has been experienced by the resident
redcap:DataQualityRules.rule_logic: [ae_neuro] = 1 and [ae_anxiety] = 1 and [ae_behaviour] = 1 and [ae_depression] = 1 and [ae_dizzy] = 1 and [ae_drowsy] = 1 and [ae_headache] = 1 and [ae_malaise] = 1 and [ae_hyperactivity] = 1 and [ae_no_sleep] = 1 and [ae_aggression] = 1

redcap:DataQualityRules.rule_name: At least severity for one chest/respiratory symptom must be selected as a chest/respiratory adverse event has been experienced by the resident
At least severity for one cardiovascular symptom must be selected as a cardiovascular adverse event has been experienced by the resident
At least severity for one a skin/cutaneous symptom must be selected as skin/cutaneous adverse event has been experienced by the resident
redcap:DataQualityRules.rule_logic: [ae_skin_condition] = 1 and [ae_swollen_mouth] = 1 and [ae_hypersensitivity] = 1 and [ae_itching] = 1 and [ae_eczema] = 1 and [ae_sweating] = 1 and [ae_cyanosis] = 1

redcap:DataQualityRules.rule_name: At least severity for one nasal symptom must be selected as a nasal adverse event has been experienced by the resident
Date 60 day check is completed must be 60 days after randomisation date
The protocol violation assessment date must be after the suspected violation date

redcap:SurveysScheduler.email_content:
Dear [consultee_firstname],

Thank you for your continued interest in the participation of [pt_firstname] in the PROTECT-CH trial. 

Further to your recent discussion with a member of the research team/nurse we hope that you now understand what taking part in the trial involves and have had your questions answered. 

What do I need to do next?
If after reading the information and speaking to a member of the research team/nurse, you decide that [pt_firstname] would have no objection to taking part in the trial and taking the trial medication, please read, sign and submit the Informed Consent Form using the link below:

[survey-link]

Please complete the Informed Consent Form as soon as possible. If, however, you do not wish for [pt_firstname] to take part in the trial and/or take the trial medication please email: protect-trial@nottingham.ac.uk or telephone: 0115 748 7710

Further information
You can find more information about the PROTECT-CH trial on the trial website using the link below:

PROTECT-CH website

If you have any further questions, please contact the trial research team (contact details below) who will be more than happy to help. 
 
Kind regards

PROTECT-CH trial research team
Telephone: 0115 748 7710
Email: protect-trial@nottingham.ac.uk
Website: http://www.protect-trial.net

Dear [pi_plr_firstname],

Thank you for your continued interest in the participation of [consent_arm_1][pt_firstname] in the PROTECT-CH trial. Their care home is now ready to start the PROTECT-CH trial. A trial doctor will review [consent_arm_1][pt_firstname]'s medical records to ensure they are able to continue in the trial, and if the care home is allocated to deliver a trial medication, [consent_arm_1][pt_firstname] will start taking this in the next few days.

If you would like to read the information about the trial and trial medication again, you can find it at the link below.

[Insert web address for PROTECT-CH Legal Representative Information Sheet]

If you are satisfied that [consent_arm_1][pt_firstname] would continue to have no objection to taking part in the trial, you do not need to do anything else. 

If, however, you do not wish for [consent_arm_1][pt_firstname] to take part in the trial please let us know as soon as possible using the contact details below.

You can find more information about the PROTECT-CH trial on the trial website using the link below:

PROTECT-CH website

If you have any further questions, please contact the trial research team (contact details below) who will be more than happy to help. 
 
Kind regards

PROTECT-CH trial research team
Telephone: 0115 7487710
Email: protect-trial@nottingham.ac.uk
Website: http://www.protect-trial.net

Dear [consultee_firstname]

Thank you for your interest in finding out more about the PROTECT-CH trial. We are contacting you about the possible participation of [pt_firstname] as you are their named Legal Representative for decisions about their care. You have recently been contacted by their care home to let you know that the care home is taking part in the PROTECT-CH trial and were interested in learning more about the trial.

A member of the research team/nurse will shortly be contacting you to arrange a call at your convenience, to talk to you in more detail about the PROTECT-CH trial, answer any questions that you may have, and explain the next steps. In the meantime, please do take a few moments to read the information on the trial which explains what participation means for you and [pt_firstname]. 

Please find below a link to the Information Sheet which will tell you everything you need to know about taking part in the trial:

[Insert web address for PROTECT-CH Legal Representative Information Sheet]

You can find more information about the PROTECT-CH trial on the trial website using the link below:

PROTECT-CH website

If you are not interested in your the person you are representing taking part in the trial and do not wish to receive any further communication please email: protect-trial@nottingham.ac.uk or telephone: 0115 748 7710

If you have any further questions, please contact the trial research team (contact details below) who will be more than happy to help. 

Kind regards

PROTECT-CH trial research team
Telephone:  0115 748 7710
Email: protect-trial@nottingham.ac.uk
Website: http://www.protect-trial.net

redcap:Alerts.alert_title: CH to complete questionnaires after RN countersigned resident consent
redcap:Alerts.email_subject: Action: required: Complete questionnaires and eligibility assessment for Resident ID: [pat_id]
redcap:Alerts.alert_message:
Dear [ch_name_only] staff,

The consent form for Resident ID: [pat_id] was countersigned by the research nurse on [rn_sign_date].

 

Please log in and complete the EQ5DL proxy, demographics, eligibility assessment and vaccination status forms at the links below.  Residents with capacity are also required to complete a self-reported EQ5D5L. You may assist the resident in completing the survey, however the responses given should be their own:

 

[form-link:consent_form_administration:Consent Form Administration]

 

Important information regarding reporting a resident’s vaccination status:

 

COVID-19 vaccinations:

For COVID-19 vaccinations, you must record all vaccinations that your residents have received, even if they were prior to the start of the PROTECT-CH trial.

You should then continue to record any additional COVID-19 vaccinations (e.g. any boosters) that the resident receives following consent.

 

Non-COVID vaccinations:

Resident's may not be eligible to take PROTECT-CH trial treatments if they have recently received a live vaccination.

It is crucial that you record any vaccinations that a resident has received in the 14 days prior to consent. You should then continue to record any additional vaccinations that the resident receives following consent.

 

If you have any further questions, please contact the trial research team (contact details below) who will be more than happy to help.

 

Kind regards

PROTECT-CH trial research team

 

Telephone: 0115 7487710

Email: protect-trial@nottingham.ac.uk

Website: http://www.protect-trial.net

redcap:Alerts.alert_title: CH to complete questionnaires after RN countersigned PLR consent
redcap:Alerts.email_subject: Action: required: Complete questionnaires and eligibility assessment for Resident ID: [pat_id]
redcap:Alerts.alert_message:
Dear [ch_name_only] staff,

The personal legal representative consent form for Resident ID: [pat_id] was countersigned by the research nurse on  [rn_csign_date].

 

Please log in and complete the EQ5D5L proxy, demographics, eligibility assessment and vaccination status forms at the links below:

[form-link:eq5d5l_proxy:Quality of life EQ5D5L and EQ-VAS questions]

 

Important information regarding reporting a resident’s vaccination status:

 

COVID-19 vaccinations:

For COVID-19 vaccinations, you must record all vaccinations that your residents have received, even if they were prior to the start of the PROTECT-CH trial.

You should then continue to record any additional COVID-19 vaccinations (e.g. any boosters) that the resident receives following consent.

 

Non-COVID vaccinations:

Resident's may not be eligible to take PROTECT-CH trial treatments if they have recently received a live vaccination.

It is crucial that you record any vaccinations that a resident has received in the 14 days prior to consent. You should then continue to record any additional vaccinations that the resident receives following consent.

 

If you have any further questions, please contact the trial research team (contact details below) who will be more than happy to help.

 

Kind regards

PROTECT-CH trial research team

 

Telephone: 0115 7487710

Email: protect-trial@nottingham.ac.uk

Website: http://www.protect-trial.net

redcap:Alerts.alert_message:
Dear [consent_arm_1][consultee_firstname],

Thank you for your continued interest in the participation of [consent_arm_1][pt_firstname]  in the PROTECT-CH trial. 

Further to your recent discussion with a member of the research team/nurse we hope that you now understand what taking part in the trial involves and have had your questions answered. 

What do I need to do next?
If after reading the information and speaking to a member of the research team/nurse, you decide that [consent_arm_1][pt_firstname] would have no objection to taking part in the trial and taking the trial medication, please read, sign and submit the Informed Consent Form using the link below:

[survey-link:consent_form_resident_without_capacity]

Please complete the Informed Consent Form as soon as possible. If, however, you do not wish for [consent_arm_1][pt_firstname] to take part in the trial and/or take the trial medication please email: protect-trial@nottingham.ac.uk or telephone: 0115 748 7710

Further information
You can find more information about the PROTECT-CH trial on the trial website using the link below:

PROTECT-CH website

If you have any further questions, please contact the trial research team (contact details below) who will be more than happy to help. 
 
Kind regards

PROTECT-CH trial research team
Telephone: 0115 748 7710
Email: protect-trial@nottingham.ac.uk
Website: http://www.protect-trial.net

Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText:
Prophylactic Therapy in Care Homes Trial (PROTECT-CH)
Informed Consent Form
[pis_ver], [pis_ver_date]

 

IRAS Project ID: 294832
Participant's name:  [pt_firstname] [pt_lastname]
Participant Study ID  [pat_id]

Question.TranslatedText: Tick the box if participant is not able to read the text and/or sign for themselves but has capacity to give consent

I confirm that my care home and the research team have discussed the PROTECT-CH trial with me and given me the Participant Information Sheet dated: [pis_ver_date], version: [pis_ver], which I have read and understood. I have had the opportunity to consider the information, ask questions and have had these answered satisfactorily.

I understand that taking part is voluntary and that I can withdraw at any time, without giving any reason. My medical care or legal rights will not be affected. I understand that if I withdraw, the information collected so far cannot be deleted and may still be used in the trial.

I understand that if my care home is allocated to give usual care or my care home is allocated to give a trial medication that I cannot take I will not receive the trial medication. I will continue receiving my usual care.
I agree to my GP being informed of my participation in this trial. I agree to the research team contacting my GP for further information regarding my medical history and current medications.

I understand that relevant sections of my medical notes and data collected in the trial may be looked at by authorised individuals from the Nottingham Clinical Trials Unit (NCTU), the Sponsor (University of Nottingham), central NHS bodies, trusted third parties, the research team and regulatory authorities where it is relevant to my taking part in this trial. I give permission for these individuals to have access to my records and for the NCTU to have a copy of my signed consent form.

I give permission for the NCTU, the Sponsor, trusted third parties and the research team to collect, collate, store, analyse and publish information obtained from my participation in this trial. I understand that my personal details will be kept confidential.

I understand that all information and personal data relevant to the trial will be shared with, stored and maintained by my care home, GP, trusted third parties, NHS Digital and other central UK NHS bodies in order to help contact me or provide information about my health status.
I understand that the anonymised information collected about me may be used to support other research in the future and may be shared with other researchers.
I agree that my legal representative can discuss my ongoing involvement in the trial, should I lose capacity to make this decision for myself during the trial.
I agree to take part in the above trial.

Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText: Optional consent:

Question.TranslatedText: I agree to be approached about taking further medications or other treatments as part of this trial in the future.
I am happy to be contacted about taking part in an interview to talk about my experience of taking part in this trial.
I witnessed accurate reading of the consent form to the potential participant, who could ask any questions and got satisfactory replies. I confirm that they gave their consent freely.
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText:
I witnessed accurate reading of the consent form to the potential participant, who could ask any questions and got satisfactory replies.

I confirm that they gave their consent freely.

Question.TranslatedText: Prophylactic Therapy in Care Homes Trial (PROTECT-CH) Legal Representative Informed Consent Form [plr_pis_ver], [plr_pis_ver_date] IRAS Project ID: 294832 Participant's name: [pt_firstname] [pt_lastname] Participant Study ID: [pat_id]
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText:
Prophylactic Therapy in Care Homes Trial (PROTECT-CH)
Legal Representative Informed Consent Form
[plr_pis_ver], [plr_pis_ver_date]

 

IRAS Project ID: 294832
Participant's name:  [pt_firstname] [pt_lastname]
Participant Study ID: [pat_id]

Question.TranslatedText: I confirm that the care home and the research team have discussed the PROTECT-CH trial with me and given me the Legal Representative Information Sheet dated: [plr_pis_ver_date], version: [plr_pis_ver], which I have read and understood. I have had the opportunity to consider the information, ask questions and have had these answered satisfactorily.

I understand that taking part is voluntary for the person I am representing and that I can request they are withdrawn at any time, without giving any reason. Their medical care or legal rights will not be affected. I understand that if I withdraw them, the information collected so far cannot be deleted and may still be used in the trial.

I understand that if the care home of the person I am representing is allocated to give usual care or the care home is allocated to give a trial medication that the person I am representing cannot take, they will not receive the trial medication. They will continue receiving their usual care. I agree to questionnaires being completed about the health of the person I am representing during the trial whether they are allocated to usual care or usual care plus medication.

I agree to the GP of the person I am representing being informed of their participation in this trial. I agree to the research team contacting their GP for further information regarding their medical history and current medications.

I understand that relevant sections of the medical notes of the person I am representing and data collected in the trial may be looked at by authorised individuals from the Nottingham Clinical Trials Unit (NCTU), the Sponsor (University of Nottingham), central NHS bodies, trusted third parties, the research team and regulatory authorities where it is relevant to them taking part in this trial. I give permission for these individuals to have access to the records of the person I am representing and for the NCTU to have a copy of this signed Consent Form.

I give permission for the NCTU, the Sponsor, trusted third parties and the research team to collect, store, analyse and publish information obtained from participation in this trial by the person I am representing. I understand that their personal details will be kept confidential.

I understand that all information and personal data relevant to the trial will be shared with, stored and maintained by the care home, GP, trusted third parties, NHS Digital and other central UK NHS bodies in order to help contact the person I am representing or provide information about their health status.
I understand that the anonymised information collected about the person I am representing may be used to support other research in the future and may be shared with other researchers.

I give permission for the NCTU, the Sponsor and the research team to collect and store my contact details to discuss trial treatment options with me for the person I am representing. I understand my personal details will be kept confidential.
In my opinion, the person I am representing would have no objection to taking part in the above trial.

Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText: Optional consent:

Question.TranslatedText: I agree to be approached about the person I am representing taking further medications or other treatments as part of this trial in the future.
I am happy to be contacted about taking part in an interview to talk about my experience of taking part in this trial.
I confirm I am the Legal Representative for the participant named above.

Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText: For NCTU Upload Paper Consent

ItemDef.Name: cfs_instructions
ItemDef.redcap:SectionHeader:
Clinical Frailty Scale (CFS)
If Resident has capacity, to be completed by resident and care home staff together. Otherwise, to be completed by a member of care home staff who provides care to the resident on a daily basis.

Question.TranslatedText: Use the following definitions to determine the Resident Clinical Frailty Scale (CFS) status. Very fit People who are robust, active, energetic and motivated. These people commonly exercise regularly. They are among the fittest for their age. Well People who have no active disease symptoms but are less fit than Category 1. Often, they exercise or are very active occasionally, e.g. seasonally. Managing well People whose medical problems are well controlled, but are not regularly active beyond routine walking. Vulnerable While not dependent on others for daily help, often symptoms limit activities. A common complaint is being "slowed up", and/or being tired during the day.
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText:
Use the following definitions to determine the Resident Clinical Frailty Scale (CFS) status.

  1. Very fit

People who are robust, active, energetic and motivated. These people commonly exercise regularly. They are among the fittest for their age.

  1. Well

People who have no active disease symptoms but are less fit than Category 1. Often, they exercise or are very active occasionally, e.g. seasonally.

  1. Managing well

People whose medical problems are well controlled, but are not regularly active beyond routine walking.

  1. Vulnerable

While not dependent on others for daily help, often symptoms limit activities. A common complaint is being "slowed up", and/or being tired during the day.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the Resident's Clinical Frailty Scale (CFS) status?

Question.TranslatedText: For xxxxxxxxxxx: The drug appendix for xxxxxxxxxxx describes dosage as twice daily, administered as follows: Intranasal 140 µL spray into each nostril = one push of the nozzle. If you were unable to administer a spray into each nostril, a spray or attempted spray into at least one nostril should still be reported as a dose.
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText:
For xxxxxxxxxxx:

The drug appendix for xxxxxxxxxxx describes dosage as twice daily, administered as follows:

  • Intranasal 140 µL spray into each nostril = one push of the nozzle.

If you were unable to administer a spray into each nostril, a spray or attempted spray into at least one nostril should still be reported as a dose.

ItemDef.Name: treat_dose_cic_info
ItemDef.redcap:BranchingLogic: [treatment_arm_1][treat] = 1 and [treat_admin] = 1 and [startdate] <> '' and datediff([treatment_arm_1][treat_date], [enddate], "d", "dmy", true) >= 0 and [calc_treat_disc] <> '1' and datediff( [startdate], "today", "d","dmy", true) >= [treat_last_week_days] and [max_dose] > 0 and [randomisation_arm_1][rand_treat_code] = 2

Question.TranslatedText: For xxxxxxxxxxx: The drug appendix for xxxxxxxxxxx describes dosage as once daily, administered as follows: Two puffs (320 µg) inhaled via mask via mouth sequentially. Participants who are unable to tolerate a face mask will use the spacer mouthpiece taking two puffs. One puff (160 µg) inhaled via mask via nose. Participants who are unable to tolerate a face mask will not receive the intranasal puff. If you were unable to administer the dose exactly as described above, any puff or attempted puff via the nose or mouth should still be reported as a dose.
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText:
For Ciclesonide:

The drug appendix for xxxxxxxxxxx describes dosage as once daily, administered as follows:

  • Two puffs (320 µg) inhaled via mask via mouth sequentially. Participants who are unable to tolerate a face mask will use the spacer mouthpiece taking two puffs. 
  • One puff (160 µg) inhaled via mask via nose. Participants who are unable to tolerate a face mask will not receive the intranasal puff. 

If you were unable to administer the dose exactly as described above, any puff or attempted puff via the nose or mouth should still be reported as a dose.

ItemDef.redcap:BranchingLogic: ([treatment_arm_1][treat] = 1 and [treat_admin] = 1 and [startdate] <> '' and datediff([treatment_arm_1][treat_date], [enddate], "d", "dmy", true) >= 0 and datediff( [startdate], "today", "d","dmy", true) >= 0 and [calc_treat_disc] <> '1' and [event-name] <> concat('week_',[treatment_arm_1][treat_weeks],'_arm_1') and [continue_treat] = '0' and ([treat_disc_reason] = 6 or [treat_disc_reason] = 7)) or ([treatment_arm_1][treat] = 1 and [treat_admin] = 1 and [startdate] <> '' and datediff([treatment_arm_1][treat_date], [enddate], "d", "dmy", true) >= 0 and [calc_treat_disc] <> '1' and datediff( [startdate], "today", "d","dmy", true) >= [treat_last_week_days] and [treat_dose] < (0.7 * [max_dose]) and ([treat_miss_reason] = 6 or [treat_miss_reason] = 7)) or ([startdate] <> '' and datediff( [startdate], "today", "d","dmy", true) >= 0 and ( [ae_nasal_conditions] = 1 or [ae_gastro] = 1 or [ae_resp] = 1 or [ae_neuro] = 1 or [ae_cardio] = 1 or [ae_skin_condition] = 1))

Adverse events are common in this population due to the range of underlying comorbidities, therefore events that are deemed expected for this population should not be reported. Please click here to see a list of events that do not require reporting. Should one of these events be reported, you may mark the event as 'not SAE', unless you have reason to believe that it might be related to the trial treatment.

Question.TranslatedText: click here to hide The following events are frequent in care homes and will not be evaluated as SAEs Agitation Allergic reaction (not related to trial medication) Anorexia, loss of appetite Bowel obstruction Bruising, ecchymoses Confusion COVID-19 (part of the primary outcome) Delirium Dehydration Diarrhoea, during confirmed norovirus or Clostridium difficile outbreak Fall with injury, with/without fracture Heart failure, volume overload Hypoglycaemia Hypotension Incontinence (urinary, bowel) Medication (non-trial) error Nursing care, missed Pressure ulcer Respiratory infection (non-COVID-19) Sepsis, bacteraemia Skin tear, abrasion, breakdown Suicide, attempted suicide, self-harm Surgical/procedural site infection Urinary tract infection, with/without catheter Venous thromboembolism Vomiting during confirmed norovirus outbreak Similarly, diagnoses present at baseline (including any worsening of that condition) and known co-morbidities should not be evaluated.

click here to hide
